intro: Pelargonium alchemilloides subsp. multibracteatum, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that are often hairy, and it thrives in well-drained soil. It is a compact shrub that is often used in rock gardens and as a container plant due to its ornamental value. Its common name reflects its historical use in traditional medicine.
